newsitem.title: GERMANY: Germany to need more money for unemployment - Bluem.
newsitem.headline: Germany to need more money for unemployment - Bluem.

text.p: Germany's Federal Labour Office will need more money this year due to higher unemployment, Labour Minister Norbert Bluem said on Friday.
"That we need more money (for the labour office) is the result of higher unemployment," Bluem said in a radio interview.
Last year Germany had to boost the supplement it paid for the Federal Labour Office to 14 billion marks from an initially budgeted level of 4.3 billion marks due to higher than expected unemployment.
This year, in a belt-tightening effort aimed in part at meeting the requirements for European monetary union it budgeted 4.1 billion marks for the supplement.
But Labour Office President Bernhard Jagoda said last week it was likely to need six billion marks more.

The government forecasts that unemployment will average 4.1 million this year, up from 3.9 million last year, but the climb to a postwar record 4.7 million in January and February made many economists sceptical it could reach the goal.

Bluem said it was important to focus on creating new jobs, as only working people paid unemployment insurance premiums. He called for more flexibitlity for part-time workers, that would allow a reduction in overtime for regular workers.
